Summary: Terrible.   For 100 dollars I got a room with a soaking wet carpet a terrible smell and a 1√ó2 inch bar of soap.   Well there was a small patch of carpet that was dry on the way to the bathroom.  The front desk did not seem to understand my complaints.

Summary Heading: Ok hole in wall. Satisfactory for basics
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights. Room was an upstairs unit and quite small, would be very tight for more than 2 persons. Room was very basic with a comfy queen bed, good size flat screen tv on wall, small refrigerator freezer and microwave. Bath area had place to hang clothes and sink counter was big enough to put large travel suitcase along with bath items. Shower was very old and needed to be resurfaced and drain didn‚Äôt drain too good, place was clean with two trash baskets. Room was very dark when wood blinds drawn closed. Nighttime was quiet had no issues with homeless or vagrants. Parking is very tight but never went without a place on property for car. Office personnel were friendly and helpful. Great Mexican food at jalape√±os less than a mile away well worth the trip, ate there

This is not a high end hotel. It has tiny rooms, a dinky bathroom, a "kitchenette" area.   The walls are freshly painted, fairly new carpet, new windows. Overall, the room was basically clean except for the kitchen area. Said kitchen area had a left behind bag of potato chips in a cupboard, an ancient fridge with a rusted shelf, and two very dried mouse poops on top of the microwave. The hot water in that sink did not turn on, but the cold worked. There were Non-remodeled cupboards, drawers and a two burner hot plate. This kitchenette was behind a door.   No closet, there was a rack with a bar in one corner to hang clothes. There was a large flat screen tv in the room. The bed is not top end, but not low end either, medium firmness.   The hotel is in old town Tustin and close to

Summary Heading: An old tired motel that has seen better days
Summary: I'm not sure if this was the worst experience I've had at a hotel in my whole life but it certainly has to be close. There was a cigarette burn hole in the bed spread. I was there for 4 nights and the internet worked correctly one night, for a couple hours another night and not at all the other 2 nights. One day they skipped maid service and didn't clean the room. The bathtub was badly damaged and somebody tried to repaint it in a miserable fashion. The bath tub drain was so slow I had to shower quickly or end up standing in my own dirty bath water. There was no stopper of any kind for the vanity sink. The TV had a problem and the picture was a bunch of color blobs. It was cheap and the days they did clean the room it wasn't too bad. That's about all I can sya good about it.
Room tip: The only reason to ever stay here is if it's the only place you can afford. Otherwise avoid it.

Summary Heading: This old 50's motel rehabbed and is nice
Summary: This rehabbed old small motel has very nice small rooms update very skilled craftsmen, parking is very tight, no coffee makers in rooms, no comp breakfasts, security must be problem as glass shield at reception, rates very low compared to chain motels, air conditioner made lots of noise, quiet and very clean-so all and all a good bargain and nice place

Summary Heading: Great place at a reasonable rate!
Summary: This is a great place to stay! The rooms are newly upgraded with carpeting, paint and beautiful crown moulding. The rooms all have new casement windows with plantation style shutters. The bathrooms have been remodeled as well with new bathtubs, shower stalls, counter tops and fixtures. Some rooms are also offered with a kitchen area with nice counter top, sink and fixtures. I have stayed here many times and each time I find that the rooms are clean and quiet. Great rates!

I have stayed at half a dozen motels in the LA area and this is by far the best, cleanest, comfiest room. Clean, nice small kitchen with stove (in my unit), quiet, it is just like I would have my room at home. 10/10

Quiet and clean. Good area for the most part. Parking can be a little bit better. Rooms in the very front are large and comfortable. If u run the AC u don't hear the traffic at all. Front desk staff can be a little unnerving but other than that a good stay. I will be back.

terrific location for exploring and enjoying Tustin. Rooms are clean. Our bathroom had been recently remodeled, clean. Rooms are small but not an issue. Fridge and microwave in room. And the price is right, under $90.

Summary Heading: Very quiet, clean, great jacuzzi tub
Summary: It is very convenient to old town Tustin; updated and quiet.  The room contained a very comfortable bed with good clean linens. I really enjoyed the jacuzzi tub.  There was a mini-fridge as well as a microwave.  The manager was very courteous. I have no complaints. The only downside was that there was no pool.

Me and my girlfriend stayed like 4 times already . The first time was like alright , but then we stayed recently and I was amazed . Very quiet , I spent two days back to back , left some our things there , went back and it was still there . Love it üëçüëçüëç

With everywhere else already booked when looking at the last minute this was the only place available. Positives ..Comfortable Bed and Free wi-fi, fridge and microwave  Negatives.. Room needs an update, lino floor in bathroom, Paint missing from spots on Wall, Room like a Sauna on arrival, air con ineffective in cooling room.

I chose to stay here on my last night of a SoCal trip.  Bad choice!  I picked the place because the price was right and it was in reasonable proximity to the airport and "Old Town" Tustin.  The room smelled musty.  The bathroom was a disaster.  The water was lukewarm at best.  The toilet barely flushed.  There was no coffee maker and no continental breakfast.  The WIFI worked "most" of the time.  The good things were that it was quiet (although from the look of some of the vehicles parked by rooms adjacent to mine that could change) and it was close to Old Town.  I would not recommend this hotel.

This place is one step behind Motel 6. The room smelled stuffy, bathroom not super clean but not too dirty. Dated room especially the bathroom. but served its purpose. It looked like people lived in the motel. For the price, there are better options in the area.

I have stayed at the motor lodge for the past 11/2 years, nearly once a month. Granted some of the beds are hard and left me hurting the next day but I found that you can always go to the owner (also manager) and he will make sure you are as happy as possible. Our non smoking room had been smoked in and the owner up graded me to a large, fancy room for free. Any issues are always dealt with right away.  The units I have stayed in are compact but always clean (no nasty sheets etc) and compared to more expensive hotels, you won't get athletes foot here. Everything gets scrubbed and bleached daily.  At $60.00 a night this cozy place is close to freeways, restaurants, fast food and grocery. They come with small fridge as well as microwave (at no extra charge, like Motel 6).  Give
Manager Response: Dear Ines A.,   Thank you so much for your wonderful review and for being such a loyal customer to the Tustin Motor Lodge over the past couple of years. We take great pride in accommodating our customers needs so that they have a very comfortable and enjoyable stay with us.   We hope during your next stay with us, you will find our newly installed mattresses much more comfortable. Once again, we appreciate your kind review and look forward to seeing you again.   Sincerely,   Niel A.  Manager

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Very inexpensive so if you want to save money, you can.  Full size bed, felt like cardboard and padding was put on top of box springs, fairly hard.  No alarm clock in room.  There is a microwave and tiny reefer in the room.  Extremely close to all freeways, and restaurants very close.

I've been at the Tustin Motor Lodge for two months and could not find a single thing to complain about over that long time period - management is competent and nice, room service is great and staff is very friendly.  The place is quiet and clean and has good wireless internet access (never failed during the 2 month stay). The room was very confortable and the room service was nice to the point of waiting extra time to clean the room after a couple of late wake ups of mine - definitely 5 stars.  Plus, there are a lot of good restaurants within walking distance.  I'll certainly return here when I need to stay in Tustin.

The Tustin Motor Lodge in Tustin, CA is probably the best deal I've seen in quite a while, especially in Southern California. I had a bad experience there once before, but I decided to give it  a shot as a last resort since I was in a bind. The management has changed, and the rooms have been refurnished (dark wood & granite countertops). The price of a basic room with one queen sized bed, a tub in the bathroom, A/C and Heat, with free HBO and ESPN is an astounding $50 a night (after tax). The room was clean, the beds were freshly made, and the staff was always courteous and friendly, and happily accomodated my need for more towels. This motel is close to old town Tustin and right off the I-5  freeway. As always, I asked for a quiet room in the back, and the manager happily

Summary Heading: I'd rather have Two Ciggarette Budds on my pillow please
Summary: Do all motels perpetuate the alleged stereotype as ‚ÄúTACKY‚Äù and ‚ÄúRUDE‚Äù establishments?  Yes, only if you book a room at the Tustin Motor Lodge Motel.  Not only is there the challenge of parking into compact-sized space (considered ‚Äúguest parking‚Äù) but one would have to deal with the rude profiling from guest services. This ‚Äúopened 24 hour‚Äù motel doesn‚Äôt require holding reservations, but a booking upon request.  In this sense, this is to mean that all available rooms will be ready and clean upon reservation. Unfortunately, there was a ‚Äúmishap‚Äù and we received a room that looked already occupied.   When we entered the unit and it smelled of opened beer and smoked cigarettes. Next to our honestly advertised color television set were roughly 40 beer bottles. Half were empty in trash
